pr_title: module INT-SYMBOLIC: marking just [symbolic] what can be common for Java and Haskell

timeline.message: module INT-SYMBOLIC: marking just [symbolic]. No longer [kore]
fix: need new module INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE for pieces not compatible with Java backend.

timeline.bodyText:
The module import structure here seems a bit weird to me.
We have INT-SYMBOLIC import INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE and INT-COMMON, but INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE already imports INT-COMMON. Is this intentional @denis-bogdanas .
timeline.author: ehildenb
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -433,7 +433,25 @@ module INT-COMMON
                 | Int "dividesInt" Int    [function]
 endmodule
 
-module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic, kore]
+module INT-SYMBOLIC [symbolic]
+  imports INT-COMMON
+  imports INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE

replies.bodyText: @ehildenb  INT-SYMBOLIC-KORE has different attributes and is not imported all the time. So all imports are needed.
replies.author: denis-bogdanas
